page.title: 12TOURISM IN BALQUHIDDER
page.content: Over 10,000 people per year come along Balquhidder Glen to visit Rob Roy's grave in the old churchyard adjacent to the church. Very few tourists can be accommodated in the village, so most are passing through. The single track road with its passing places has more traffic than it can comfortably take in the summer months. Facilities are few but in recent years a caravan site has mushroomed on Loch Voil and another one is planned on the site of the old Balquhidder railway station. Recently opened eating places add to the interest, with Ledcreich Hotel offering the connoisseur haute cuisine as well as luxury accommodation, and the Golden Larches Restaurant offering good home fare. Self catering accommodation, mainly in converted farm steadings, is increasing and is in very great demand.
